intro: Duroia, commonly known as the "arrow poison plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. Some species of Duroia are used traditionally for their toxic properties, which have been utilized in the preparation of arrow poisons. The genus includes several species, with Duroia hirsuta being one of the most well-known.
